alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 07 at 2:03AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Pennsylvania...including the following county...Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 201 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated an area of heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - For Perkiomen Creek at East Greenville: At 1:47am the stage was 5.15 feet. Flood Stage is 5 feet. The gauge crested around 12:30 AM EST near 5.3 feet and will continue to fall through 3 AM EST. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
